title: Authors and Citation
text: Jadey Ryan. Author, maintainer. Molly Mcilquham. Author. Dani Gelardi. Author. Washington State Department Agriculture. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ryan J, Mcilquham M, Gelardi D (2023). washi: Branding Washington Soil Health Initiative. https://github.com/WA-Department--Agriculture/washi, https://wa-department--agriculture.github.io/washi/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {washi: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative},   author = {Jadey Ryan and Molly Mcilquham and Dani Gelardi},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/WA-Department-of-Agriculture/washi, https://wa-department-of-agriculture.github.io/washi/}, }

what: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: Inspired branding R packages glitr, ratlas, nmfspalette, washi provides color palettes themes consistent Washington Soil Health Initiative (WaSHI) branding.

title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: can install development version washi GitHub :

title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: list names available palettes, call names(washi_pal). view palette, use washi_pal_view() function.

title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: palette primarily access individual brand colors fonts, table headers, graphic backgrounds, etc. colors accessible may color blindness.  Individual colors can accessed washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]].

what: WaSHI colors adjusted to be color-blind safe
title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: Available green, blue, red, gold.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: Creates flextable WaSHI's style.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
code: washi_flextable(   data,   cols_bold = NULL,   header_font_color = "white",   header_bg_color = washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]],   border_color = washi_pal[["standard"]][["tan"]] )

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: data dataframe table. cols_bold Numeric indices columns bold. Defaults NULL. header_font_color Hexcode color header font. Defaults white. header_bg_color Hexcode color header background. Defaults WaSHI green. border_color Hexcode color horizontal borders. Defaults WaSHI tan.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable
text: flextable formatted WaSHI's style.

title: WaSHI flextable style — washi_flextable

what: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
title: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
text: Opens font files install computer.

title: Install Lato and Poppins fonts on your system — washi_install_fonts
WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
text: Color palettes stored named list.

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
text: object class list length 11.

title: WaSHI color palettes — washi_pal
code: # List names of available palettes names(washi_pal) #>  [1] "standard"        "color_blind"     "accent"          "green_highlight" #>  [5] "blue_highlight"  "red_highlight"   "gold_highlight"  "green_gradient"  #>  [9] "blue_gradient"   "red_gradient"    "gold_gradient"    # Get hex codes from a palette using dollar `$name` or double bracket # `[["name"]]` operators for extracting list elements washi_pal$standard #>     green      blue       red      gold      gray    ltgray       tan     cream  #> "#023b2c" "#335c67" "#a60f2d" "#fcb040" "#3e3d3d" "#7C7979" "#ccc29c" "#F2F0E6"   washi_pal[["green_gradient"]] #> [1] "#023B2C" "#1C4F40" "#376355" "#51776A" "#6C8B7E" "#879F93" "#A2B3A8" #> [8] "#BCC7BC"  # Extract a color from the standard WaSHI palette washi_pal[["standard"]][["green"]] #> [1] "#023b2c"

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: Choose desired number colors whether colors reversed.

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: Setup a color palette — washi_pal_setup
text: vector color hex codes.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: Show colors within palette plot.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: View a WaSHI palette — washi_pal_view
text: plot color displayed.

what: Register Lato and Poppins fonts in R — washi_register_fonts
title: Register Lato and Poppins fonts in R — washi_register_fonts
text: Register Lato Poppins fonts R

title: Register Lato and Poppins fonts in R — washi_register_fonts

what: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: Provides compatibility ggplot2.

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
code: washi_scale(   palette = "color_blind",   aesthetics = c("color", "fill"),   alpha = 1,   reverse = FALSE,   discrete = TRUE,   ... )

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: palette Character name palette washi_pal. See names(washi_pal) list available palettes. aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . Defaults c("color", "fill"), applies palette color fill aesthetics time. alpha Numeric transparency level color 0 1. Default 1 (transparent). reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE. discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete . Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed discrete_scale() scale_color_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
text: ScaleContinuous ScaleDiscrete object can added ggplot object.

title: Scales for plotting with WaSHI palettes — washi_scale
code: library(ggplot2)  # Discrete scale with color aesthetic ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3.5) +   theme_minimal() +   washi_scale("color_blind", aesthetics = "color", alpha = 0.7)   # Discrete scale with fill aesthetic ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(vs), color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar(fill = "white", linewidth = 1.5) +   theme_minimal() +   washi_scale("color_blind", aesthetics = "color", reverse = TRUE)   # Continuous scale ggplot(diamonds) +   geom_point(aes(x = carat, y = price, color = price)) +   theme_minimal() +   washi_scale("green_gradient", reverse = TRUE, discrete = FALSE)
